channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report X-2024020413
item.description:
Report X-2024020413

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-20
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Management called QA about damaged hazmat in the unload area. Once hazmat was identified, proper eye and wear gear was used to move box into a red tote and transport to cage for inspection. DescribePack: After inspecting, plastic jug was damaged to loose cap which caused a small amount of liquid to spill out into box. There were no inner packing materials inside of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Proper eye and wear gear were used to placed damaged hazmat into red tote and move to hazmat cage for inspection.

item.title: Report E-2024020302
item.description:
Report E-2024020302

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 0.5 pounds of UN1486 "Potassium Nitrate 325 Mesh" were released from two 25-pound paper bags due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 5-gallon DF containing two empty product paper bags of Potassium Nitrate 325 Mesh and PPE and (1) 15-gallon DF containing Potassium Nitrate 325 Mesh were created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage, NO drains, waterways, or soil were impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024020291
item.description:
Report E-2024020291

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 3 gallons of Phenoline 1205 Part A (UN1263) was released from a 4-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 20-gallon DM containing one 4-gallon metal pail of Phenoline 1205 Part A and oil dri was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
